00029 #ifndef __AllocatedObject_H__
00030 #define __AllocatedObject_H__
00031 
00032 #include "OgrePrerequisites.h"
00033 
00034 // Anything that has done a #define new <blah> will screw operator new definitions up
00035 // so undefine
00036 #ifdef new
00037 #  undef new
00038 #endif
00039 #ifdef delete
00040 #  undef delete
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 namespace Ogre
00044 {
00056     template <class Alloc>
00057     class _OgreExport AllocatedObject
00058     {
00059     public:
00060         explicit AllocatedObject()
00061         { }
00062 
00063         ~AllocatedObject()
00064         { }
00065 
00067         void* operator new(size_t sz, const char* file, int line, const char* func)
00068         {
00069             return Alloc::allocateBytes(sz, file, line, func);
00070         }
00071 
00072         void* operator new(size_t sz)
00073         {
00074             return Alloc::allocateBytes(sz);
00075         }
00076 
00078         void* operator new(size_t sz, void* ptr)
00079         {
00080             (void) sz;
00081             return ptr;
00082         }
00083 
00085         void* operator new[] ( size_t sz, const char* file, int line, const char* func )
00086         {
00087             return Alloc::allocateBytes(sz, file, line, func);
00088         }
00089 
00090         void* operator new[] ( size_t sz )
00091         {
00092             return Alloc::allocateBytes(sz);
00093         }
00094 
00095         void operator delete( void* ptr )
00096         {
00097             Alloc::deallocateBytes(ptr);
00098         }
00099 
00100         // Corresponding operator for placement delete (second param same as the first)
00101         void operator delete( void* ptr, void* )
00102         {
00103             Alloc::deallocateBytes(ptr);
00104         }
00105 
00106         // only called if there is an exception in corresponding 'new'
00107         void operator delete( void* ptr, const char* , int , const char*  )
00108         {
00109             Alloc::deallocateBytes(ptr);
00110         }
00111 
00112         void operator delete[] ( void* ptr )
00113         {
00114             Alloc::deallocateBytes(ptr);
00115         }
00116 
00117 
00118         void operator delete[] ( void* ptr, const char* , int , const char*  )
00119         {
00120             Alloc::deallocateBytes(ptr);
00121         }
00122     };
00123 
00124 
00128 }
00129 #endif
